page.title: 08Shipwreck
page.content: The Land's End can be viewed in two different ways.Seen by the landsman it is usually thought of as the romantic westernmost tip of Britain, with beau- tiful views across the Longships Light house to the wide Atlantic. To the sailor, however,it means one of the most dangerous landfalls in the world. Countless ships have found a watery grave amongst the hidden reefs, confused currents and treacherous tides of this area.The shipwreck which most emphasised the need for a life boat at Sennen was that of the "New Commercial" in 1851.During a lengthy, difficult and heroic rescue three of the ten people were rescued by the com bined efforts of several groups, most notably the men and boats of Sennen. As a direct result of this operation the first Sennen lifeboat was deliver- ed to the village in June,1853.
